resources.string: Espresso poured on a vanilla ice cream. Served in a cappuccino cup.

Espresso with added hot water (100-150 ml). Often served in a cappuccino cup. (The espresso is added into the hot water rather than all the water being flowed through the coffee that would lead to over extraction)
A tall, mild milk coffee (about 150-300 ml). An espresso drink with steamed milk and only a little milk foam poured over it. Serve in a latte glass or a coffee cup. Flavoured syrup can be added.
A popular coffee drink with equal parts espresso, steamed milk, and milk foam. Usually served in a cappuccino cup.
Espresso mixed with hot chocolate, topped with steamed milk and whipped cream. Served in a tall glass or a coffee cup.
Espresso stained with a dash of steamed milk or foam. Usually served in an espresso cup.
A strong, concentrated coffee brewed by forcing hot water through finely-ground coffee beans. Served in a small espresso cup.
An espresso-based drink with steamed milk but little to no foam, creating a smoother texture. Served in a small cup.
Coffee brewed with cold water over a long period (usually 12-24 hours). Served cold, often with ice and milk.
A shorter and more concentrated version of espresso, made with less water, resulting in a more intense flavor. Served in an espresso cup.
Starbucks Corporation is an American multinational chain of coffeehouses and roastery reserves headquartered in Seattle, Washington. It is the world\'s largest coffeehouse chain.

It is undeniable that Janji Jiwa outlets have spread to various corners. Janji Jiwa is a local coffee brand that is popular among students, students, workers and even families. Carrying the jargon "coffee from the heart", Janji Jiwa is committed to serving coffee with a classic taste for coffee lovers.
At Kopi Kenangan, their dream is to serve high quality coffee, made with the freshest local ingredients to customers across Indonesia â€“ and the rest of the world
